body:
Comment 4 by **karatepekka**: 
rsc: Would the best fix be to change the type of the panic'd error (in
reflect->value.go) to os.Error, which would require no change in the json-code or to
recover from panics of "string" type in json-code? Both approaches have good and bad
effects. Or maybe this kind of errors (when values can't be set in reflect-package, i.e.
CanSet == false) should have a distinct type and we could recover only from those
specific kind of panics.
